description: A fully automatic carbine manufactured by AC, based on the F2000 bullpup assault rifle from FN Herstal.  Made from laminated plastic, it gets its nickname after it's appearance, but don't let that trick you.  Custom technology, such as the weapon's targeting system compensating for the target's movement on the fly, rubber coating and a special carbon dioxide recycling system absorbing virtually all of the external recoil, and an integrated flash hider simultaneusly working as a supressor, make it a deceptively effective weapon.
//2: This is the closest thing to a F2000
//3: Rescued from the now obsoleted fs2000 , edited to make it more close to the AC version

description: A prototype anti-materiel rifle manufactured by AC, modified from the Barrett M82A1 anti-tank rifle.  Custom technology allow it to shoot .50 BMG at 3070 m/s, approximately 3.3 times the amount of the blueprint.  Because of that, shooting the rifle in full-auto causes an uncontrollable amount of recoil, unless the user is trained to counteract it.
//3: Muzzle speed is 3070 vs the M107A1 853 or the .50 BMG ~928 m/s -> ~ x11 times the kinetic energy ( 0.5 * m * v^2 ). This is WAY too high, so I'm just multiplying it x2

description: A mass production anti-materiel rifle manufactured by AC, modified from the Barrett M82A1 anti-tank rifle.  Custom technology allow it to shoot .50 BMG at 3070 m/s, approximately 3.3 times the amount of the blueprint.  Features further upgrades over the MX prototype, such as an improved handle, scope, and an in-built cooling system.  The full-auto mode was removed, to prevent excessive recoil.
